Label: 2001 Q1
Insight: As we start our exploration, Russia has the lion's share of 2600-plus Grandmasters at 25.  Western Europe (Germany, France, England) have a smattering as does the USA.   India has only 2.

Label: 2001 Q2
Insight: Things have not changed much.  Armenia and the former Soviet Central Asian republics such as Azerbaijan have a smattering and Holland has 4.

Label: 2001 Q3
Insight: China now has 4. France is up to 7, Hungary and the USA sit at 5.  Russia dipped a little to 24.

Label: 2001 Q4
Insight: Germany is now up to  7, Russia is back to 25, USA is at 6 and Israel is at 4. Former Soviet GMs often emigrate to Israel and possibly further on.

Label: 2002 Q1
Insight: China is still at 4 and Germany at 7. Future powerhouse India is only at 1. Russia is down to 23 and Ukraine and USA have 4.

Label: 2002 Q4
Insight: China is up to 5, France at 6, and Germany still at 7.  Holland has 4 and USA moves up to 8. Of these, 1 is inactive (Fischer), and 6 are from former Soviet republics. Only 1 (Seirawan) grew up playing in USA.
